src.system.database

Class MyDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.system.database.MyDatabase

  • public class MyDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for database query and updates
    Version:
    1.4, Date: 21 February 2015
    Author:
    Steffen Vissing Andersen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MyDatabase()
      Constructor for a mysql database with username = "root", an empty password string and database name not specified.

      Constructor for a mysql database with username = "root" and an empty password string.

      Constructor for a mysql database.

      Constructor.

        public MyDatabase(java.lang.String driver,
                  java.lang.String url,
                  java.lang.String user,
                  java.lang.String pw)
           throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        driver - the name of database driver
        url - the full url for the database
        user - the username for database
        pw - the password for database
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if driver cannot be loaded

           throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Constructor for a mysql database.
        Parameters:
        databaseName - the name of the database
        user - the username for database
        pw - the password for database
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the mysql driver cannot be loaded

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the mysql driver cannot be loaded

           throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

    • Method Detail

      • query

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object[]> query(java.lang.String sql,
                                                     java.lang.Object... statementElements)
                                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returning the result from an SQL query in the form of an Object array for each row. All Object arrays are returned in an ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        sql - the SQL statement to execute. Starting with "SELECT".
        statementElements - a number of statement elements each representing an element for a placeholder in the SQL string.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList with an Object[] for each row in the query result
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something went wrong in the connection or query

      • queryString

        public java.lang.String queryString(java.lang.String sql,
                                    java.lang.Object... statementElements)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returning the result from an SQL query in the form a String
        Parameters:
        sql - the SQL statement to execute. Starting with "SELECT".
        statementElements - a number of statement elements each representing an element for a placeholder in the SQL string.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList with an Object[] for each row in the query result
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something went wrong in the connection or query

      • update

        public int update(java.lang.String sql,
                  java.lang.Object... statementElements)
           throws java.sql.SQLException
        An SQL update.
        Parameters:
        sql - the sql updates to execute. Could start with "UPDATE", "INSERT", "CREATE", ...
        statementElements - a number of statement elements each representing an element for a placeholder in the SQL string.
        Returns:
        an integer representing the number of updates given by the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something went wrong in the connection or update

      • updateAll

        public int[] updateAll(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> sqlList)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        A number of SQL updates.
        Parameters:
        sqlList - an ArrayList containing SQL updates to execute.
        Returns:
        an integer array representing the number of updates given by the database for each statement
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something went wrong in the connection or update

      • updateAll

        public int[] updateAll(java.lang.String fileName)
                throws java.sql.SQLException,
                       java.io.FileNotFoundException
        A number of SQL updates from a text file with each SQL statement ended by a semicolon.
        Parameters:
        fileName - a filename for a text file containing SQL updates to execute.
        Returns:
        an integer array representing the number of updates given by the database for each statement
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something went wrong in the connection or update
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if text file cannot be found
